meanings.definition: Having a specified number or type of hands.
meanings.sent1: The three-handed alien amazed the scientists.
meanings.sent2: She admired the two-handed clock on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The one-handed robot tried to juggle.
meanings.sent5: The six-handed monster was a child's nightmare.

meanings.definition: Using a particular hand in preference to the other.
meanings.sent1: He was a right-handed pitcher in baseball.
meanings.sent2: She was left-handed and struggled with scissors.
meanings.sent3: The ambidextrous clown confused the audience.
meanings.sent4: The skilled artist was known for his steady-handed brushwork.
meanings.sent5: The nimble-fingered pianist played with her left-handed grace.

meanings.definition: Transferring or giving something to someone else.
meanings.sent1: She handed the book to her friend.
meanings.sent2: He handed out flyers for the event.
meanings.sent3: The magician handed the card back to the audience member.
meanings.sent4: The teacher handed out the test papers to the students.
meanings.sent5: The waiter handed the menu to the hungry customer.
